Copy of the Resolutions of New York made July 14, 1774
Copy of the Resolutions of New York made July 14, 1774

10 Resolutions â€“ To support King George III but view with grief some lat acts of Parliament; Blocking the Boston Port is arbitrary; Destruction of Tea not only Motive for bringing distress on its people; To assist a sister colony in distress; To propose a congress of delegates from different colonies; To leave to this Congress to determine mode of action; That our inestimable Rights and Liberties supersede all others; That a non importation partially observed like the last would answer no good purpose; That the delegates of the New Congress pledge themselves for the Good Conduct; Thanks to citizens of Great Britain who support Colonies
